column10: Controlled Foreign Corporation Rules, Exemptions
column11: Controlled Foreign Corporate Rules: Taxable Income
column12: Interest Deduction Limitations

column10: CFC exempt if located in a “listed” country or if it passes the active income test.
column12: 1.5:1 debt-to-equity ratio (15:1 for financial institutions) applies.

column10: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted.
column12: Informal 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies.

column10: None
column11: All Income Associated with Non-genuine Arrangements
column12:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.
5:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies to intragroup loans.
1:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies to receivables from shareholders or directors, managers, and liquidators.

column4: Countries with a tax treaty or Tax Information Exchange Agreement
column10: Multiple rules may exempt CFC from taxation.
column12: 1.5:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies.

column10: None
column12:
3:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies. 
A surtax for excessive-indebtedness can apply.

column4: EU member states and EEA member states
column10: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted.
column12: 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 debt-to-equity ratio for certain financial services companies) applies.

column4: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
column10: Foreign subsidiaries are exempt if less than 1/3 of their income is financial income.
column12:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies.
Interest deductions are limited to 2.7% of assets.
Interest and depreciation deduction limited to 30% of EBITDA.
Other rules can apply.

column4: EU member states and EEA member states and Switzerland
column10: CFC exempt if profits below €750,000 or passive income below €75,000.
column11: All Income Associated with Non-genuine Arrangements
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column4: EU member states and EEA member states
column10:
CFC exempt if i) located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement; ii) industrial, manufacturing, and shipping business; or iii) Finland has a double-tax treaty with the foreign
country (excluding tax treaty countries mentioned in a 'black list').
column12:
Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA.
Net interest expenses between non-related parties limited to €3 million.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement or if CFC carries out trading or manufacturing activity.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA country with exchange of information agreement and not an artificial arrangement.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if i) real economic activity; ii) below certain profit threshold and ratio; or iii) located in country with treaty allowing for an exemption.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EEA countries or has a double-tax treaty with Iceland and not an artificial arrangement.
column12:
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA.
Rule does not apply if total interest paid does not exceed ISK 100 million. Other exemptions can apply.

column4: EU member states and tax treaty countries
column10: CFC exempt if i) below certain profit and income thresholds; ii) transfer pricing rules apply; or iii) passes the essential purpose test.
column11: All Income Associated with Non-genuine Arrangements
column12:
None.
However, in specific cases interest can be reclassified as a dividend.

column10: None
column12: None.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement. Other exemptions can also apply.
column12: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA.

column10: Various exemptions can apply.
column12: 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio (2:1 for particular repo transactions) applies.

column10: CFC rules don't apply to active income if CFC has fixed facilities engaged in business in the foreign country.
column12:
2:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions) applies.
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA (financial institutions exempt).

column10: CFC exempt if profits below €750,000 or passive income below €75,000 and CFC is not based or incorporated in a tax haven.
column11: All Income Associated with Non-genuine Arrangements
column12:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies (certain financial institutions exempt).
Interest deductions limited if interest payments both exceed €3 million and 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if country included in white list and not receiving special tax treatment or taxed subject to a corporate rate of more than 11.25%.
column12:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies.
Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA.
Rule does not apply if entity's debt-to-equity ratio is not (or at most 2 percentage-points) lower than the group-consolidated ratio.

column10: CFC exempt if i) not an artificial arrangement or ii) accounting profits  below €750,000 or less than 10% of operating costs.
column11: All Income Associated with Non-genuine Arrangements
column12:
Informal 85:15 debt-to-equity ratio applies.
Interest deductions limited to the higher of 30% of EBITDA or €3 million (financial institutions exempt).

column10: None
column12: 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies.

column10: CFC exempt if not an artificial arrangement.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €1 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: Limited exemption for certain Australian CFCs.
column12: Numerous restrictions on debt-to-equity ratio apply.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EEA country and not an artificial arrangement or located in tax treaty country.
column12: Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA.

column4: EU member states and EEA member states and Switzerland
column10: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of PLN 3 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EU and EEA countries and not an artificial arrangement. Other exemptions can apply.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €1 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: None
column11: All Income Associated with Non-genuine Arrangements
column12: Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA (financial institutions exempted).

column10:
Substantial economic activities
exemption.
column12: 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €1 million or 30% of EBITDA.

column10: CFC exempt if located in EEA and not an artificial arrangement or located in white list countries.
column12: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA.

column10: N/A
column12: Debt-to-equity ratios apply and vary by asset class.

column10: None
column12: 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions) applies.

column10: Various exemptions can apply.
column12: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA.

column10: Exemptions for foreign high-taxed income can apply.
column12: Interest deductions limited to the sum of business interest income, 30% of adjusted taxable income, and floor plan financing interest.
